activities:
Personal information that AmniSure® may receive from the EEA and Switzerland can be categorized as follows: 
1.	HR Information: personal data is collected from employees and prospective employees in the context of employment relationship and potential employment relationship. This data may be sent to the United States from the EU subsidiaries and Switzerland or vice/versa. 
2.	Clinical trial data: personal data from patients included in clinical trials are collected globally (including from the EU and Switzerland). This data is transferred to the United States for clinical analysis and research purposes or vice/versa. 
3.	Patient information during complaint handling: on occasion when handling a product complaint personal data is shared unintentionally. This is considered protected health information under HIPAA and is treated accordingly. 
4.	Customer information: personal information may be shared with AmniSure® at conferences, via the AmniSure® website or through general business communications with AmniSure® employees, such information is used for AmniSure® business development.
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: All personal information, as outlined above, including manually processed data.
recoursemech:
EU Data Protection Authorities (DPAs) Panel and
Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC)
